Clip.Title: RIVERS OF THE WORLD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The famous ancient waterway's dense history pales in comparison to it's importance for all those who live along it's banks.

Clip.Title: THE LAST TIGHTROPE DANCER OF ARMENIA
Clip.Episode: The Last Tightrope Dancer of Armenia
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The two most celebrated tightrope dancers in Armenia are now in their 80s. Now they share the same hope -- that the only remaining tightrope student will carry on their life's work. But will 17 year old orphan Hovsep want to accept the responsibility?

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi, the train of Reunification carries Emmanuelle Han on a 1,726 kilometer voyage.

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rabbi Shifren takes inner city LA high school students surfing for the first time to get them out of their 'world is a ghetto mentality.'

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rev Bill Baldwin fights for peace to prevent escalation of Palestinian-Israeli tensions in the divided city of Hebron.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Canada's easternmost point to Europe's westernmost point, this aerial survey explores the Atlantic coastline, from the wonders of St. John's Newfoundland and the Avalon peninsula - to the unique islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vintage clothing store owner Doris Raymond is always on the lookout for the "Holy Grail"; the iconic piece that has been touched by one of the world's greatest designers. During a trip to an expo show in Dallas, she learns of such a garment, found discarded at the bottom of a closet

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The history of 20th-century America is on display at Doris Raymond's vintage clothing boutique, The Way We Wore(R). Decades of high fashion from iconic designers fill the racks of this boutique, each telling a story about society at the time.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get the real story behind some of the silver screen's most iconic films and characters.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The tiny region of Valle d'Aosta remains agricultural and pastoral, where winter and summer sports take place the year round. This is a regione marked by National Parks, castles and ancient santuaries.

Clip.Title: MINDFIELD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Canadian Light Source is a facility where scientists can see matter at an atomic level. Featuring science fiction author Robert. J. Sawyer during his time at this world class facility.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Algae, Quest Quiz: Algae and Synthetic Biology
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Could pond scum become the fuel of the future? Explore the amazing potential of algae and find out if could be the next generation of biofuels. Find out the tools that synthetic biologists are using to make biology easier to engineer so that new functions can be derived from living systems. What are they building?

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Tagging Pacific Predators, Your Photos and Mercury in The World's Oceans
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Thanks to a tagging program, scientists are learning that tuna in open oceans travel thousands of miles around the Pacific. And, photographer and naturalist John Albers-Mead captures sometimes-sunken treasures with his digital camera. And mercury is a hidden danger in the world's oceans. Now, experts plan to clean it up.

Clip.Title: THE INCREDIBLE BIONIC MAN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The quest to build and animate an artificial being entirely from bionic parts shows the incredible strides we've made in body replacement technologies.
